metadata.title: CVE-2015-3885 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the ljpeg_start function in dcraw 7.00 and earlierallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a craftedimage, which triggers a buffer overflow, related to the len variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
libraw9 - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libfreeimage3 - 3.15.4-3ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
freeimage package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.15.4-3ubuntu0.1+esm2').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
